headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body: Hi, thanks for writing in. However, your repro code does not function and I don't see what the actual problem is yet. Can you revisit your report and correct errors?
@seratch i updated the issue, this happens when using claude models

Thanks for addressing this,
Do you know if this just suppresses warnings or resolves the issue with Claude.
When I used it despite warnings, it would leak system prompt or internal instructions.

Additionally, do you know when is this gonna be released?  @seratch

This just suppresses warnings for the models that produces litellm-incompatible pydantic models in the scenario. I haven't checked the other issues, but I feel those should be resolved on the litellm side. This warning is the same, but I've applied a quick workaround for now. The change will be released this week.
